This is my favorite part you can fling the trash into the back.
collectors if you want the new green get it here.
p.s if your don't want to pay $6.95 shipping go to the lego store they have tons don't worry.

column1:
,TRUE,4,3,5,4,5 wollongong0","2011-11-15T23:23:18.573Z","4432 - Garbage Truck","

Today I am going to review the 4432 Garbage Truck. It costs $20 US dollars. Here are some pros and cons.
Pros

• Rubbish Thrower
  • Trash Bins
  • Mini Figures
  • Price
  • Size - Very Big
Cons

• Back tail piece don't stay up well.
  • Women Mini Figure - Women don't do this job.

Overall a very good set. Lets look at the ratings.

Younger Kids - 8 / 10

Older Kids - 6 / 10

Adults - 6 / 10

",TRUE,5,4,4,5,5

skypirate,"2011-12-09T10:40:05.147Z","Tailgate at your own risk","Overall
I was happy about a follow-up to the 7991 Recycle Truck. Overall, it's a very nice set. The 4432 Garbage Truck successfully addresses the 7991's ambitious, but fragile dumping mechanism, but falls short on style. OK, it's a garbage truck, maybe they aren't supposed to be stylish and don't need to be aerodynamic. It's just a little too boxy for me. I wish there were a few more slopes or curves to the cab and maybe cylindrical fuel tanks.

Build
Two part build, simple and straight forward. While building I did notice that it seems like the chassis is a nice design that is incredibly sturdy. The build experience was somewhat routine, standardized cab and front grill build.

Parts
There are some interesting SNOT parts and building techniques hidden away in this kit. And a nice collection of curved slope parts.

One thing to note, in the production photos, the truck green bricks look like an interesting avocado green. Notice the difference between the truck's green and the green recycle can in the ""dumping"" photo. In my kit, the truck parts were really the recycle green.

Playability
As mentioned earlier, it seems above average in sturdiness. But, on the road, I wouldn't want to drive too closely behind this garbage truck as it tend to ""leak"" or drop smaller parts such as the banana through a 1x4 gap at the back. Maybe I built it wrong, should be an easy fix to close the gap.

Value for the Money
Seems about right for 2012 and the economy.
",TRUE,4,5,4,3,5

Harmonious_Building,"2011-12-24T22:50:50.407Z","Garbage stinks - this set does not.","If you were to ask me to compile a list of things that people find appealing - whether they be kids or adults - I have to admit that a garbage truck is not the first thing that comes to my mind. They're large, unsightly, smelly, and always seem to be clanging around the neighbourhood on the mornings when you're trying to sleep in. Yet, it's clear that garbage workers (or ""sanitation specialists"" as we're probably supposed to call them nowadays) provide a vital service to any community, as the 1968 New York and Memphis strikes in the United States quickly proved, so perhaps there is a reason to allow kids to get a chance at cleaning up the mean streets of LEGO - not that there would be much littering going on, given the near-perpetual levels of police surveillance. 

The Garbage Truck is the latest (as of 2012) in a long series of garbage trucks that have rolled out of LEGO's engineering department, but this is the first of its kind that I have owned, and I love every inch of it. You get a piece count that's appropriate for a set of this price, and you also pick up a pair of sanitation worker Minifigs, a very good deal for a vehicle set, and one that makes complete sense since sanitation workers usually work in pairs in real life anyway. This augments a very satisfying build that results in a good-looking model, and also one that works amazingly well to boot. 

The front of the truck is excellent as always, and its flat front and removable roof should come as no surprise to anyone who has even one other LEGO truck (I personally recommend the Tank Truck (3180), it being a personal favourite among the ones that I own thus far). The most exciting thing about this model - and one that is not readily apparent from the pictures - is the collection and dumping mechanism that fit flawlessly together into the truck's construction. At the back of the truck, there exists one mechanism for emptying the trashcan into the truck's interior, a second mechanism for opening the back of the truck (probably to in a policeman to come searching for narcotics or pirated DVDs or communist leaflets or whatever it is LEGO policeman are constantly searching for), and a third that allows the truck to tip out its unwanted contents into the dumping ground of your choice (perhaps you could use one of those old raised Castle baseplates and use that as a landfill instead?). Oh, and did I mention that those gloriously curved side panels are easily removable for even more access to the inside of the truck? Well, I did now, and they do. 

Garbage Truck is the first of the 2012 vehicles that I own, and I am completely won over. If you are a vehicle enthusiast, a City collector, or are just looking for a feature-heavy vehicle with lots of playability, Garbage Truck is exactly what you want. I usually shy away from giving the hyperbolic five bricks for everything, but I really cannot think of what I could possibly fault this set over, except perhaps for including a vexing collection of round stickers. Make sure you apply them before the eggnog. 
",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

bluemodern,"2011-11-27T20:46:22.223Z","Excellent garbage truck. ","I had the 6693 Refuse Collection Truck as a kid and this set seems much more realistic and larger. This set also seems to have a wider base than the 6693 set. 

On the back side is a black steering wheel that turns and is connected through a technic part to the trash can holder base that allows for dumping the contents of the trash can into the back of the truck, which is a very nice touch. The set comes with two garbage cans, one green and one gray. As trash there are two fish, a banana peel, and some light and dark brown 1x1 round plates. The set has two minifigures, a male and a female garbage worker. I think this is the first time Lego has included a female garbage worker. I think this is nice for children to see different gender roles. On the minus side there are no doors on the front of the garbage truck. The garbage truck is a very nice green and white color. For 208 pieces at $20, the value is pretty good at slightly less than $0.10 per piece. There are quite a few extra pieces as well. Overall, the set looks very realistic and would be a great addition to any town. 
",TRUE,5,5,5,5,4

aiac,"2011-11-24T00:18:25.62Z","Very good truck, very good garbage.","

This garbage truck is a nice addition to any motor pool. There have not been many garbage trucks over the years. This one uses the newer truck building techniques which are quite good in general.


The inclusion of a trash compactor mechanism is great. It works well enough as designed, but can be made better with a few slight modifications. The dumping system is also pretty good.


Subjectivly, the fuel tanks could be one or maybe two plates thicker so that it is easier to pick up the vehicle without holding on to the dumping part. This is only an issue if the truck needs to be repositioned and can not be driven to its destination.


There are two workers, and the parts which make up the ""garbage"" to be hauled away are great. Old fish and banana peels are perfect.


Other than a slightly inefficient loading mechanism, and the lack of a running board for the feet of the worker that is riding on the  back, this is excellent. Even in light of those minor (and fixable) shortcomings, this is worth picking up.

",TRUE,4,4,4,4,5

Monty,"2012-03-05T18:16:49.077Z","Not Rubbish - In Fact Very Good","

This set appeared in the UK around Christmas time and I thought about getting it a few times. I cracked and bought it in our local supermarket last week and made it this weekend.
The parts come in 2 bags so you are advised to build them in sequence shown to minimise the parts search.

The build is farily straightforward and uses some of the new 2012 elements, including the brighter green elements which are the same colour used for some baseplates. There is a tipping mechanism worked by a wheel on the side which lifts and empties the bins into the rear of the body. The the rear of the body lifts up so the whole body can be tipped and emptied. There are 2 minifigs, 2 dustbins and assorted rubbish comprising 2 fish and a banana and some 1x1 round bricks so you have somethin to tip - good playability.

When I was a small child, I was absolutely fascinated by the weekly visit of the dustcart as we called it, and I would watch as the hydraulics tipped our bin up and would then see it retun to the ground amazingly empty. Things have moved on a lot in the design and appearance of these vehicles since then, but buying this model has rekindled my interest in the machines. I decided the front looked like a DENNIS machine which are everywhere in the UK so i made a moc DENNIS sticker for the front.

The colours match those of my local Council, and I think that is also what drew me to it - I have added some moc stickers with the local Council's logo as well as tweaking the colours to add some lime green too which matches the local vehicles.

I enjoyed the build and making my modifications, including actually removing the oversize tipping mechanism and adding an extra set of rear wheels as most larger DENNIS dustcarts seem to have 2 axles at the rear. I also removed the side handrails and the brush and shovel clipped to the rear, and replaced them with a side control panel instead, but the set remains basically the same. I like the overall look and playability with the 2 minifigs 2 dustbins and assorted rubbish as well as the price so I have awarded it a maximum overall score, and would recommend it to anyone.

Lint,"2012-05-29T05:15:07.23Z","The Trash is Treasure","

This year's garbage truck set comes with a very modern looking garbage truck, 2 garbo minifigs (male and female), 2 trash cans and an assortment of trash including fish, bananas and pieces of, well... trash. The truck itself comes with rails for the garbos to hang onto, clips for their tools and a trash loading and dumping mechanism.
Pros

• Lots of great pieces for a city set. Plenty of enviro-green and transparent orange pieces as well as minifig accessories such as trash cans, fish, banana, broom and shovel.
  • Build was actually quite fun for a simple set.
  • Rubber tyres. Love em
  • Smokestack. Love it
  • The trash loading gimmick is great fun
Cons

• The trash loading and dumping mechanism doesn't work TOO well. It's a challenge to get all the trash deep into the trash compartment, trash tends to fall out of the truck if it goes over a bump and the dumping gimmick can be a bit hit and miss.
  • Cab can only fit one minifig and he has to climb in through the roof. I know this is the norm with modern set design but I still have the right to complain :P
  • Minifigs are a bit plain. They could have simulated some dirtyness to their overalls to give them character.
  • Stickers

Overall you get a really good looking garbage truck and a few new accessories to decorate your city with. Even if the play gimmicks are a little broken, this set wins with visual appeal alone and will fit in well with your Lego City!

",TRUE,4,5,5,4,4
itsaturkey,"2012-02-17T23:08:52.14Z","Trash Never Looked So Good!","      I was never very interested in City, but I don't know why. Every City
set I've ever gotten I've loved. This set was no exception. The build
was stimulating and took me half an hour to complete at a

comfortable/slow pace.
      It's broken up in two bags, the truck in one and
the trash compacter in the other. Both are relatively simple builds and
should create a fun experience for any fan of Lego. The instructions are
easy to read but do not feature the bricks needed for that page in the
upper left corner that are included in more complicated builds. Not a

big issue unless the builder is very young. The driver compartment fits one minfigure and a steering wheel. The roof pops up and allows you to access the seat. The only downside is that there is no door.
       The back is broken up in two sections, the tank and the trash flipper. The tank is simple and sleek and quite sturdy. Two bars on the side allows a Minifig to hold on for the stops.
The color is light-ish green and white. Downside is that the front has a
big whole that trash will sometimes fly by and hit the driver if you

flick the trash hard enough.
       The trash flipper is attached to the tank
with a lever. A switch with a wheel on the side will dump a trash cans
trash into the tank. This provides lots of playability. No problem with

this that I can see. The tank leans back and can dump out the trash.
      It
includes two trash cans, a grey one and a blue one. Also included is two
fishes and a banana along with a shovel and a broom. The two minfigures are nothing special, but both

have blue overalls and short baseball caps.
       Overall a very worthwhile purchase, filled with a stimulating build, some special pieces and accessories and a lot of playability along with two minifigures. I have not been so pleased with a set in a long time. I Highly recommend it!
Thank you for reading!
",TRUE,5,4,4,4,5

sf1378,"2012-04-25T16:47:29.39Z","Bit disappointed...","

I'm actually a bit disappointed with this set - the figures for a start don't have matching colours for the tops i.e. too light a blue compared to the trousers/caps...The male face looks depressed too. 

I didn't really like the rear of the cab unit  - its a bit naff having no rear window made of transparent bricks - when you tip stuff in the back, like the fish or banana it can get lodged inside the cab, behind one of the 2 side plates that have the sticker on them due to the 'C' shaped angular gap the plates have...

The next thing is the tilting refuse unit - the Technic bit used isn't strong enough to hold aloft the refuse unit at a 45 degree angle as if emptying out the trash...

The side rear view mirrors are a bit weird too...

I did think the curved sides of the refuse unit would swing up and open as if to chuck rubbish in from the sides, bit of a shame there...

Finally, the tilting unit for placing the bins on doesn't fully tilt into the refuse unit as shown in the instructions, if you do push further it does go in but creates a slight gap between the tilting part and the refuse unit..

I don't think its worth the £14.11p price John Lewis priced it at...maybe its because I'm in a low mood this evening but the flaws are there.

",TRUE,3,3,3,5,2

DrOrrery,"2012-04-13T06:09:46.347Z","Looks good, but not great for play","

This is one of a half dozen city vehicle sets all in the same price range.  I've previously bought the forest fire truck (4208) and thought that was an excellent set, so I was looking forward to this set a great deal.  The fact that it looks excellent on the box also helped, but in this case looks are slightly deceiving.

Box/Instructions

2 numbered packets for easy building.  Quite a few stickers but the model looks good without them if you don't feel like applying them.

Parts

The set is mostly green and white, with quite a few orange transparent bricks including some cheese wedges.  There's nothing particularly strange apart from perhaps the exhaust pipe on the truck, but it's a good mix of pieces.  However, at 208 pieces it's a bit light on compared to other sets in a similar price range.

Minifigures

The set has 2 minifigures, identical apart from the heads.

The build

It's a straightforward but fun build, starting with the chassis and cabin.  This will be fairly familiar to anyone who has built any of the recent lego trucks.  The side mirrors are done differently to most others I've seen, with hinge connectors slanted up, but most of it is fairly straight forward.  The garbage section is much more interesting, with a wheel for tipping the garbage bins into the back of the truck and a large hinge that allows the entire back section to open up.

The completed model

Once completed, the model looks great.  What you see on the box is what you get, a fairly accurate looking garbage truck with very nice curves on the side and a working bin tipping and load tipping action.  I can definitely not fault it for looks.

Playability is a different matter.  The most troubling problem with this set is it is really difficult to pick up.  The first inclination is to grab the curved garbage storage section on the back.  The trouble is, this hinges and the connection to the hinge (a 3x2 surface) cannot take ANY weight at all.  The chassis will fall off it immediately.  So you have to remember to pick it up by the chassis.  But if you do that and accidently tip it at all, the garbage storage section will hinge back, fall off and break in to a dozen pieces.  The sides panels here are only held on by a 2x1 surface, which means they come off easily.  This is a double edged sword, useful if something has got stuck in there that shouldn't, but also meaning that if you drop it at all they come off.  In fact the whole storage section is pretty weak and will shatter very easily.

Summary

This is a really good looking set, but if you buy it to play with then expect to spend half your time putting it back together again.  Personally, I think the forest fire set (4208) beats it hands down.  That said, it does look good and there's a decent amount of playability there, just don't pick it up.

",TRUE,3,3,4,3,3

What_Sup_Lego_Fans,"2012-07-07T23:35:05.737Z","4432 Garbage Truck - Is it worth it or not?","

The 4432 Garbage Truck contains 201 pieces as well as 2 minifigures. It was a bit of a letdown in some cases but there are also some good things to this set. So here are the good and bads.
Pros

• The dumping technology is very efficient and smart.
  • Plenty of new pieces.
  • The trash bins are different colors.
  • It has a very good design to it.
Cons

• The minifigures are not wearing proper clothing for their job.
  • There is not enough trash so it limits playability.
  • It does not dump the trash very well.
Overall, I think if you don't have the other garbage truck released, then you have to buy it. But if you don't, you might want to buy it. But you have to consider if you want it because it lacks playability more than the other Great Vehicles sets. ",TRUE,3,5,5,2,3

wangym,"2012-04-04T08:02:57.46Z","One of my first Lego sets...","

This is actually the second set ever since I started my Lego collection ""career"" (a few days ago).

I'm always a big fan for trucks, so this set seems to be a must-have for me. Overall speaking I'm quite happy with the result: charming color scheme (love the way it looks that the truck's front is almost entirely built out of the tannish transparent window blocks), some cute details: e.g. they have the pedal to step into the truck's cab (although the door cannot be opened like in 4434), lots of playability: the wheel that tilt the plate and pour the trash-bin is quite awsome (although in my opinion that the pole connecting to the wheel is a bit short that it cannot reach into the hole in the other end of the base)

Box/Instructions

No much to say, I guess they just did the job ?

Parts

As a fresh for Lego, almost all the parts are still quite new to me, but the 4 white cylinders form the truck's body does come to my mind

Minifigures

Not sure

The build

Fluent

The completed model

Smaller (and in the same time longer) than I'd originally thought it would be

Summary

Nice looking truck packed with a lots of playability

",TRUE,4,3,4,4,3

gustavowizard,"2013-06-18T17:25:55.917Z","The Best Official Garbage Truck ","Building Experience and Parts

I had a really nice time building this set, i really like the green/white combination colors because i saw a lot of garbage trucks witht those colors, and also pretty similar on RL, witch makes the model pretty realistic too; it really look like a real garbage truck! I like the way the side curves of the lateral plates.

Playability

Ok im not a Kid so i can´t really say how cool would be to play with this (since i just collect them), but keeping in mind some stuff like the weel that spinn to put the trash inside the conteiner like on the real one, also the stick that the minifigure can hold on like on the real trucks too, and the fact that it comes with 2 full trashes is also very nice so i guess a child would have tons of fun with this, and also is educational, cause the Recycling symbol on the parts shows the kids the importance of recycling and keep the planet clean.

Value for Money

Brazil makes all legos expensive for us here, its a insult the insane taxes the charge, making a lego set cost x3 more for us here, but if i would pay 20 dollars instead of 60 like i did i would like the price :(

",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

perfectlydark,"2012-08-04T02:53:36.79Z","A solid City build, built for playability","

Another great City addition for this year, a fun and solid build, and great for playing.

Box/Instructions

I love the size of the box. Its a little too big, but it really makes me excited when picking up these lower value City sets, kind of like your getting more than you are paying for :)

Parts

Lots of green which is good. I like the white slopes too which make the 'hull' of the garbage section

Minifigures

2 Minifigs, although to be honest, they would be my least favorite 2 of the recent line of City models. They just dont seem right for this set. Brighter colours (orange) would have worked really well and contrasted with the truck perfectly

The build

It doesnt take long to build, and is pretty easy. A good kit for a young child to build and enjoy

The completed model

Looks fantastic but here is where my one major con comes into..the tipper function. Naturally as you go to pick up the truck, you grab it around the rear. This in turn tips. A locking function should have been included, as it does get quite annoying trying to pick it up only to have it tip and hang all out. I forget every single time.

Summary

Great build, only let down being the tipping function not being lockable.

",TRUE,4,4,4,4,4

LightningBricks,"2018-11-24T20:22:35.983Z","Great for your city!","

For 20 dollars, this is a nice truck for your city. It is retired, so for 22 used it isn't worth it, but under 20 it is.

Very nice playability, cools accessories and minifigures. Details are great, and the actual garbage "dumper" feature in the back is cool. Not the best set for display, but a very nice one for your city.
Ratings:
Minifigs (8/10) Average, but cool prints.
Parts (8/10) Cool shovel, food items, garbage can, and large green pieces.
"Displayibility" (2/10) Not the best for display, it is a Garbage truck, after all.
Playibility (9/10 for kids, 4/10 for adults)
Overall (8/10)

,TRUE,4,5,3,5,4 Lego4432lover","2017-02-24T12:32:10.557Z","Description on Lego city 4432 the garbage truck","

I love the minifigs and garbage they do the job I also am in love with the low shovel and broom rack and the hook for the 2nd minifig is smart I love the bucket tipper I much prefer than the 2007 verision dumping is a good job although you have to hold the first part that opens to dump stop motion makers like me won't like this overall 5/5 but 4/5 for building experience I mean I liked it but it didn't try to motivate and make me enjoy building the truck
